title: Massive swells smash windows at Sydney's Bondi Beach

titles: Massive swells smash windows at Sydney's Bondi Beach

titles: Sources: NBA probes Morant's finger-gun gesture

title: Amazon, AppLovin Bid To Buy TikTok Ahead of Deadline, Reports Say
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • Amazon and Applovin have reportedly submitted bids to by TikTok, ahead of a U.S. ban set to go into effect this weekend if no deal is reached with the app's Chinese parent company.
  • Several others have previously expressed interest in buying TikTok, including Shark Tank host Kevin O'Leary and Project Liberty founder Frank McCourt, along with Reddit co-founder Alexis Ohanian.
  • Trump is meeting with White House officials Wednesday to review an offer led by Oracle, according to reports.


Amazon (AMZN) and adtech firm Applovin (APP) have become the latest firms to bid for TikTok, ahead of a U.S. ban of the app set to go into effect Saturday if no deal is reached with the app's Chinese parent company.

Amazon submitted a letter outlining its bid to Vice President JD Vance and Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick, according to a New York Times report Wednesday. However, officials involved in talks are not taking the offer seriously, the report said, citing people familiar with the bid.

Meanwhile, Applovin has met with former Wynn Resorts (WYNN) CEO Steve Wynn about possible financial backing, according to a Wall Street Journal report Wednesday.

Amazon declined to remark on its reported bid, while Applovin did not immediately respond to a request for comment. Shares of Amazon gained 2% and Applovin shares added close to 3% Wednesday.

The offers come as Trump is meeting with Vance, Lutnick and other officials Wednesday about a potential deal led by Oracle (ORCL), according to reporting from the New York Times and others. Wedbush analysts told clients in a note Tuesday that they believe Oracle's offer could potentially serve as “a linchpin to safeguarding US consumer data” on the platform.

The analysts added they expect “some outline of a deal” could be announced before Friday night, but that an extension might also be issued to allow the parties involved to iron out details. If no deal for TikTok is reached, a U.S. ban of the app is set to go into effect Saturday, after President Trump signed an executive order in January delaying the action by 75 days.

Several others have also previously expressed interest in buying TikTok, including "Shark Tank" host Kevin O'Leary and Project Liberty founder Frank McCourt, who had submitted a proposal in January. Reddit (RDDT) co-founder Alexis Ohanian joined the bid in March.
summary: Amazon and Applovin have placed bids to purchase TikTok, as a U.S. ban looms this weekend unless a deal is made with its Chinese parent company. Other interested buyers include Kevin O'Leary, Frank McCourt, and Alexis Ohanian. The Trump administration is reviewing an Oracle-led offer, with a potential ban delayed until Saturday. Amazon's bid, outlined to Vice President JD Vance and Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick, has reportedly not been taken seriously. Applovin discussed financial backing with Steve Wynn. Both companies’ stocks rose following the news. An Oracle deal is seen as key to prot
titles: Amazon, AppLovin Bid To Buy TikTok Ahead of Deadline, Reports Say

title: Seeing humanities transition from hunting to farming as a cultural shift
snippets: Using a mathematical model, researchers have shed new light on the transition from hunter-gatherer to farming societies. Rather than focusing exclusively on external factors, they looked at internal demographics and the significant impact of human interactions. The model identified potential societal outcomes based on demographic changes, emphasizing aspects such as migration rates, cultural assimilation and the role of mortality in these transitions. The researchers aim to further develop their model with the aim of making it a standard tool for studying historical demographic interactions.
summary: Researchers developed a mathematical model to explore the transition from hunter-gatherer societies to farming communities, focusing on internal demographic changes and human interactions. The model highlights how migration rates, cultural assimilation, and mortality influenced these societal shifts. The team plans to refine the model for broader use in studying historical demographic changes.
titles: Seeing humanities transition from hunting to farming as a cultural shift

title: Metamaterials: Highly twisted rods store large amounts of energy
snippets: An international research team has developed mechanical metamaterials with a high elastic energy density. Highly twisted rods that deform helically provide these metamaterials with a high stiffness and enable them to absorb and release large amounts of elastic energy. The researchers conducted simple compression experiments to confirm the initial theoretical results.
summary: An international team of researchers has created mechanical metamaterials that can absorb and release significant amounts of elastic energy, thanks to their design of highly twisted rods that deform in a helical manner. This design grants the materials high stiffness. Their findings, backed by compression experiments, validate initial theoretical predictions.
titles: Metamaterials: Highly twisted rods store large amounts of energy

title: Being physically active, even just a couple of days a week, may be key to better health
snippets: A 'weekend warrior' approach to physical activity -- getting 150 minutes of moderate-to-vigorous physical activity over one to two days instead of throughout the week -- improved health and lowered the risk of death, finds a new stud.
summary: A new study has found that concentrating 150 minutes of moderate-to-vigorous physical activity into one or two days, known as the 'weekend warrior' approach, can enhance health and reduce the risk of death.
titles: Being physically active, even just a couple of days a week, may be key to better health

title: Asteroid impact threat estimates improved for the Earth and the Moon
snippets: An international team is currently closely tracking the near-Earth asteroid 2024 YR4. The impact probability estimates for the year 2032 has been reduced from a peak of 3 percent to below 0.001 percent.
summary: An international team is monitoring the near-Earth asteroid 2024 YR4, significantly reducing its estimated impact probability for 2032 from a peak of 3% to less than 0.001%.
titles: Asteroid impact threat estimates improved for the Earth and the Moon

title: Blood test may rule out future dementia risk
snippets: Researchers have demonstrated how specific biomarkers in the blood can predict the development of dementia up to ten years before diagnosis, among older adults living independently in the community.
summary: Researchers have identified certain biomarkers in blood that can forecast the onset of dementia up to a decade before it is diagnosed. This discovery was made in a study focusing on older adults who live independently.
titles: Blood test may rule out future dementia risk
